   character(len=*), intent(in) :: s

   character, intent(in) :: c

   integer :: i

   has_char = .false.

   do i =1, len_trim(s)

      if (s(i:i) == c) then

          has_char = .true.

          return

      end if

   end do

end function

Function to compute next_i:

function compute_next(current_i) result(next_val)

   integer, intent(in) :: current_i

   character(len=20) :: s, sb, temp

   integer :: len, j, pos

   logical :: f

   s = intToStr(current_i)

   len = len_trim(s)

   f = .false.

   sb = ''

   do j =1, len

      pos = len - j +1

      temp_char = s(pos:pos)

      if (.not. f) then

         if (temp_char == '3') then

             sb = sb // '5'

             f = .true.

         else if (temp_char == '5') then

             sb = sb // '7'

             f = .true.

         else

             sb = sb // '3'

         end if

      else

         sb = sb // temp_char

      end if

   end do

   if (.not. f) then

      sb = sb // '3'

   end if

   ! Reverse the sb to get next_str

   next_str = ''

   do j = len_trim(sb),1,-1

      next_str = next_str // sb(j:j)

   end do

   next_val = strToInt(next_str)

end function

Function check_leap:

logical function check_leap(y)

   integer, intent(in) :: y

   check_leap = mod(y,400) ==0 .or. (mod(y,4)==0 .and. mod(y,100)/=0)

end function

program main

   implicit none

   integer :: a(5), r(5), max_b, last_val, index_of_last, ans, N, c, y, final_result, current_i, next_i, sum_days, i

   logical :: leap

   ! Read the first program's input

   read *, a(1), a(2), a(3), a(4), a(5)

   ! Compute first program's ans

   max_b = -1

   last_val =0

   index_of_last =0

   do i =1,5

      r(i) = mod(a(i),10)

      if (r(i) /=0) then

         integer :: b

         b = 10 - r(i)

         if (b > max_b) then

             max_b = b

             last_val = a(i)

             index_of_last =i

         else if (b == max_b) then

             if (i > index_of_last) then

                 last_val = a(i)

                 index_of_last =i

             end if

         end if

      end if

   end do

   if (max_b == -1) then

       ans = sum(a(1:5))

   else

       ans =0

       do i=1,5

           if (i /= index_of_last) then

               if (mod(a(i),10) ==0) then

                   ans = ans + a(i)

               else

                   ans = ans + a(i) + (10 - mod(a(i),10))

               end if

           end if

       end do

       ans = ans + last_val

   end if

   ! Now, second program's N is ans

   N = ans

   ! Compute second program's c

   c =0

   current_i =357

   do

       if (current_i > N) exit

       character(len=20) :: s

       s = intToStr(current_i)

       if (has_char(s, '3') .and. has_char(s, '5') .and. has_char(s, '7')) then

           c = c +1

       end if

       next_i = compute_next(current_i)

       current_i = next_i

   end do

   ! Now, third program's y is c

   y = c

   ! Compute third program's result

   leap = check_leap(y)

   sum_days =0

   i = y +1

   do

       if (check_leap(i)) then

           sum_days = sum_days +366

       else

           sum_days = sum_days +365

       end if

       if (mod(sum_days,7) ==0) then

           if (check_leap(i) == leap) then

               final_result =i

               exit

           end if

       end if

       i =i +1

   end do

   print *, final_result

contains

   function intToStr(n) result(s)

       integer, intent(in) :: n

       character(len=20) :: s

       write(s, '(i0)') n

       s = adjustl(s)

   end function

   function strToInt(s) result(n)

       character(len=*), intent(in) :: s

       integer :: n

       read(s, *) n

   end function

   logical function has_char(s, c)

       character(len=*), intent(in) :: s

                   sb = sb // '5'

                   f = .true.

               else if (temp_char == '5') then

                   sb = sb // '7'

                   f = .true.

               else

                   sb = sb // '3'

               end if

           else

               sb = sb // temp_char

           end if

       end do

       if (.not. f) then

           sb = sb // '3'

       end if

       ! Reverse the sb to get next_str

       character(len=20) :: next_str

       next_str = ''

       do j = len_trim(sb),1,-1

           next_str = next_str // sb(j:j)

       end do

       next_val = strToInt(next_str)

   end function

   logical function check_leap(y)

       integer, intent(in) :: y

       check_leap = mod(y,400) ==0 .or. (mod(y,4)==0 .and. mod(y,100)/=0)

   end function

end program main
